meanings.definition: A person or animal that resides permanently in a place.
meanings.sent1: The indwellers of the forest built cozy homes in the trees.
meanings.sent2: The village indwellers were known for their kindness and hospitality.
meanings.sent3: The indwellers of the zoo had a meeting to discuss their living conditions.
meanings.sent4: The indwellers of the city streets navigated the bustling crowds with ease.
meanings.sent5: The indwellers of the mountain caves were experts at finding hidden treasures.

meanings.definition: The act of inhabiting or dwelling within a place.
meanings.sent1: The indwellers of the old mansion were rumored to be ghosts.
meanings.sent2: The indwellers of the garden enjoyed the peaceful surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The indwellers of the abandoned house threw a surprise party for the new owners.
meanings.sent4: The indwellers of the underground tunnels rarely saw the light of day.
meanings.sent5: The indwellers of the haunted castle whispered stories of the past to visitors.
